WORKITEMTYPE.name: Bug
WORKITEMTYPE.DESCRIPTION: Describes a divergence between required and actual behavior, and tracks the work done to correct the bug and verify the correction.

FIELD.name: Iteration Path
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The iteration of the product with which this bug is associated.

FIELD.name: Area Path
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The area of the product with which this bug is associated.

FIELD.name: Changed Date
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The date and time of the last update to the bug.

FIELD.name: Title
FIELD.HELPTEXT: Short description of the bug used to differentiate it in a list or report.

FIELD.name: State
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The workflow state of the bug.

FIELD.name: Changed By
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The person who last updated the bug.

FIELD.name: Reason
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The reason why the bug is in the current state.

FIELD.name: Created Date
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The date and time the bug was created.

FIELD.name: Created By
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The person who created the bug.

FIELD.name: History
FIELD.HELPTEXT: Discussion thread and other historical information.

FIELD.name: System Info
FIELD.HELPTEXT: Test context, provided automatically by test infrastructure.

FIELD.name: Repro Steps
FIELD.HELPTEXT: How to see the bug. End by contrasting expected with actual behavior.

FIELD.name: Priority
FIELD.HELPTEXT: Prioritizes product defect 0. Must fix ASAP, Blocking further progress 1. Should fix soon, before next major milestone certainly 2. Fix if time permits, may be postponed 3. Candidate for being cut entirely

FIELD.name: Severity
FIELD.HELPTEXT: Categorizes defect impact 0. System crash or data loss 1. User activity blocked or other severe problems - product crashes in rare cases 2. Minor functionality problems, may affect fit and finish 3. Typos, unclear wording - low visiblity

FIELD.name: Stack Rank
FIELD.HELPTEXT: Work first on items with lower-valued stack rank. Set in triage.

FIELD.name: Integration Build
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The build in which the bug was fixed.

FIELD.name: Found In
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The build in which the bug was found.

FIELD.name: Issue
FIELD.HELPTEXT: Issue type or category of the bug.

WHEN.value: Not a security bug
Buffer Overflow/Underflow
Arithmetic Error
SQL/Script Injection
Directory Traversal
Race Condition
Cross-Site Scripting
Cryptographic Weakness
Weak Authentication
Weak Authorization/Inappropriate permission or ACL
Ineffective Secret Hiding
Unlimited Resource Consumption (DoS)
Incorrect/No Error Messages
Incorrect/No Pathname Canonicalization

FIELD.name: Remaining Work
FIELD.HELPTEXT: An estimate of the number of hours remaining to complete the task.

FIELD.name: Original Estimate
FIELD.HELPTEXT: Initial rough estimate in units of hours.

FIELD.name: Completed Work
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The number of hours that have been completed for this task.

FIELD.name: How Found (Category)
FIELD.HELPTEXT: Categorization for How this bug was discovered. How Found is the 'verb' (or how) and Source is the 'noun' or (who/what).

FIELD.name: Regression
FIELD.HELPTEXT: Does this bug represent a regression in functionality or performance.

FIELD.name: Duplicate ID (Parent)
FIELD.HELPTEXT: TFS ID of duplicate bug in the same team project.

FIELD.name: Triage
FIELD.HELPTEXT: More Info: Not enough information to triage, add info and re-submit Submitted: Submitted to Shiproom Triage Approved: Approved for implementation/checkin/integration Rejected: Cannot be checked-in/integrated

FIELD.name: Source
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The source from which the bug report originated. How Found is the 'verb' (or how) and Source is the 'noun' or (who/what).

FIELD.name: Security Cause
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The cause for the security bug.

FIELD.name: Security Effect
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The effect of the security bug.

WHEN.value: Not a security bug

FIELD.name: Security Effect Scope
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The scope of the effect of the security bug. This value is used to determine the default Security Severity.

LISTITEM.value: Client - Spoofed trusted UI in common/default scenario
Client - Spoofed trusted UI in specific other scenario
Client - Spoofed UI as part of a larger attack scenario
Server - Spoofed specific user or computer over secure protocol
Server - Spoofed random user or computer over secure protocol
Client - Tampered trusted data that persists after restart
Client - Tampered data that does not persist after restart
Server - Tampered trusted data in common/default scenario that persists after restart
Server - Tampered trusted data in specific other scenario that persists after restart
Server - Tampered data in common/default scenario that does not persist after restart
Server - Tampered data in specific other scenario that does not persist after restart
Client - Attacker can locate and read information on the system including system information
Client - Attacker can read information from known locations on the system including system information
Client - Any untargeted information disclosure (random data)
Server - Attacker can locate and read information on the system including system information
Server - Attacker can read information from known locations on the system including system information
Server - Any untargeted information disclosure (random data)
Client - Denial of service that requires reinstallation of system and/or components
Client - Denial of service that requires reboot or causes blue screen/bug check
Client - Denial of service that requires restart of application
Server - Denial of service by anonymous user with small amount of data
Server - Denial of service by anonymous user without amplification in default/common install
Server - Denial of service by authenticated user that requires system reboot or reinstallation
Server - Denial of service by authenticated user in default/common install
Client - Remote user has the ability to execute arbitrary code or obtain more privilege than intended
Client - Remote user has the ability to execute arbitrary code with extensive user action
Client - Local low-privilege user can elevate himself to another user, administrator, or local system
Server - Remote anonymous user has the ability to execute arbitrary code or obtain more privilege than intended
Server - Remote authenticated user has the ability to execute arbitrary code or obtain more privilege than intended
Server - Local authenticated user has the ability to execute arbitrary code or obtain more privilege than intended

WHEN.value: Not a security bug

FIELD.name: Security Severity
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The suggested severity of the bug as determined by the Security Effect Scope.

WHEN.value: Not Applicable

FIELD.name: PS Bug ID
FIELD.HELPTEXT: This field is used for migration purposes only.

FIELD.name: Hit Count
FIELD.HELPTEXT: The number of tests or reports from the field that exhibited this issue.

FIELD.name: Source ID
FIELD.HELPTEXT: ID the source (such as Operations) uses to track the originating issue in their system or ID of the source organization (e.g. Customer/TAP/PartnerID etc).

WHEN.value: Commercial Services
Content Integration
Engineering Fundamentals
Entertainment Services
IEB Security
Knowledge Services
Services Excellence
Windows Experiences

LISTITEM.value: SOC: Staging test complete: OK for merge

Group.Label: Bug which must be resolved before this bug can be fixed
Other bugs waiting on this bug before they can be fixed
